body:
### Welcome to 'R.A.T. [R.A.T.3](http://www.cyborggaming.com/prod/rat3.htm),[R.A.T.5](http://www.cyborggaming.com/prod/rat5.htm),[R.A.T.7](http://www.cyborggaming.com/prod/rat7.htm),[R.A.T.9](http://www.cyborggaming.com/prod/rat9.htm) Mouse' evdev setups for Linux. ###About Due to terrible lack of support from evdev/Xorg in Linux for R.A.T. Mouses I decided to write my own evdev settings & configs for it. Actually there is a few well known problems with this mouse series, starting from: most keys is not binded at all; 'panoramic wheel' is not working; battery is working shorter then in Windows/Mac; program buttons are a terrible issue, aiming button is only for decoration, etc.. If you have mouse from this series and you can support me and test those settings I'll be very happy to know any of your thoughts, proposals about it. ### Author [@lostin8](https://github.com/lostin8) aka [Rafal Kruk](http://kruk.co) is responsible for all the chaos here. ### Support or Contact Having trouble with this page? Please check out the documentation at https://github.com/lostin8/docs or contact rafal@kruk.co and Iâ€™ll help you sort it out. ### Final Note Everything here is published on Creative Commons license. But please, please, please if you use my work, fork it, publish it somewhere else, or do whatever you want to do with it- do not forget to mention who wrote it, code it ,test it, document it ,etc. I spend a countless hours of work and tests just to publish it here- and I'm asking only for that simple favor. ### Info for Cyborg R.A.T. settings and docs: Author of this page is not connected in any way with MadCatz Company. Please DO NOT post, send, email me any bugs, problems not related with code published on this website, I cannot take any responsibility for any hardware related issues. You can use all setting, code published here on your own responsibility. Regards; lostin8
